alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 12:44AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Kingfisher, northwestern Caddo, northern Oklahoma, northern Lincoln, northeastern Custer, southern Blaine, Logan, southern Payne and Canadian Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1244 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Oilton to 4 miles east of Meridian to 5 miles northeast of Hydro. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Oklahoma City, Edmond, El Reno, Guthrie, Cushing, Watonga, Kingfisher, Chandler, Yukon, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Nichols Hills, Hinton, Perkins, Jones, Stroud, Langston, and Crescent. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 135 and 166. Interstate 40 between mile markers 90 and 135. Interstate 44 between mile markers 136 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Canadian; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne
